content:
• Friday, August 24, 2012
  • CLBS

    NeoStem (NBS) files a secondary offering to sell 22.97M shares of common stock for holders....

    NeoStem (NBS) files a secondary offering to sell 22.97M shares of common stock for holders. Shares +3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM | 4 Comments
  • RCI

    Canadian cable provider/mobile carrier Rogers (NYSE:RCI) is buying sports broadcaster and app...

    Canadian cable provider/mobile carrier Rogers (NYSE:RCI) is buying sports broadcaster and app developer Score Media (OTC:SCRFF), The Globe and Mail reports. Score Media, best known for its popular ScoreMobile iOS and Android apps, rose 46.7% in Toronto before getting halted. The company, whose last trade gave it a market cap of $125.8M, has reportedly been looking for a buyout price of $200M.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM
  • AKS

    Steel stocks finish lower today, continuing their decline on the back if yesterday's downgrade...

    Steel stocks finish lower today, continuing their decline on the back if yesterday's downgrade of the sector by Dahlman Rose on expectations of weak pricing: AKS -0.8%, MT -1.8%, NUE -1.1%, X -1.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • QEP

    Standard & Poor's says QEP's (QEP +6.5%) $1.38B purchase of oil and gas producing land...

    Standard & Poor's says QEP's (QEP +6.5%) $1.38B purchase of oil and gas producing land in North Dakota will not change its ratings even though QEP plans to pay for the deal with borrowing against its revolving credit facility and with cash. S&P says the deal adds to QEP's reserves and production and will diversify the gas-heavy company.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM | 1 Comment
  • WINT

    Discovery Laboratories (DSCO +8%) climbs today after Stifel Nicolaus initiated coverage earlier...

    Discovery Laboratories (DSCO +8%) climbs today after Stifel Nicolaus initiated coverage earlier with a Buy rating and a $5.00 price target. The firm says the drug developer has two FDA-approved products, Surfaxin and Afectair, both for respiratory distress syndrome, set to launch in Q4. Stifel believes these approvals, along with recent management changes, should help erase the stigma associated with the company's previous FDA rejections.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM
  • BKH

    Black Hills (BKH +7.2%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold with a $46 price target by Gabelli after...

    Black Hills (BKH +7.2%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold with a $46 price target by Gabelli after agreeing to sell its 85% interest in Bakken and Three Forks shale assets (I, II). The firm considers the deal "a significant positive given expected $0.10-$0.15 EPS accretion, improved balance sheet, reduced equity needs and the realization of significant unrecognized value."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM | 1 Comment

  • Stifel Nicolaus shows up a bit late to the party on Puma Biotechnology (PBYI +4.3%), initiating...

    Stifel Nicolaus shows up a bit late to the party on Puma Biotechnology (PBYI +4.3%), initiating coverage with a Buy rating and a $19 price target. The stock has been on fire since bottoming in early July, gaining over 30%. Perhaps investors should have kept a better eye on the insiders in this one, as one of its directors and key investors began scooping up shares at a discount as the stock came in.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM
  • NTAP

    NetApp (NTAP +4.2%) has gradually moved higher after Reuters reported Cisco (NASDAQ:CSCO) has...

    NetApp (NTAP +4.2%) has gradually moved higher after Reuters reported Cisco (NASDAQ:CSCO) has discussed buying a storage rival to current JV partner EMC. Interestingly, EMC (EMC +2.5%), is also catching a bid today. NetApp's low valuation and enterprise storage clout have often made it the subject of M&A speculation, but the company's $12.8B market cap and likely demand for a decent premium would make it tough even for Cisco to digest the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM | 1 Comment
  • POZN

    Pozen (POZN +5.3%) gives an update on its Type A meeting with the FDA regarding its drug...

    Pozen (POZN +5.3%) gives an update on its Type A meeting with the FDA regarding its drug candidate PA32540. Regulators says no additional bioeqivalence studies are needed for the drug, which is intended to reduce the risk of aspirin-induced gastric ulcers in patients as well as preventing cardio- and cerebro-vascular events.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM
  • JASO

    JA Solar (JASO -4.8%) has sold off to the $1 range. Possibly playing a role is news that the...

    JA Solar (JASO -4.8%) has sold off to the $1 range. Possibly playing a role is news that the company, which (like many solar manufacturers) has been bleeding cash, will be taking part in a $1.3B Japanese project to develop solar power plants in the country. JA's solar panels, along with those of South Korea's LS Industrial, will be used to build the plants.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM | 5 Comments
  • ALXN

    Shares of Alexion Pharmaceuticals (ALXN +2.8%) move higher again today, as rumors still swirl...

    Shares of Alexion Pharmaceuticals (ALXN +2.8%) move higher again today, as rumors still swirl about a Roche (OTCQX:RHHBY) takeover. Giving added lift is an article in Seeking Alpha suggesting the stock is poised to move up regardless of any buyout speculation. SA blog contributor Supreme Alpha points out the company has solid EPS and revenue growth rates of 37% and 46% respectively, which he thinks are the real drivers in the stock's outperformance. When you add to that mix a recently boosted FY forecast and the potential for a second drug to come to market, the commentator sees it as a great buying opportunity on its own merits.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM
  • SOL

    More on ReneSola's (SOL -13.9%) Q2: Total solar wafer and module shipments were 503 MW. Selling...

    More on ReneSola's (SOL -13.9%) Q2: Total solar wafer and module shipments were 503 MW. Selling prices for its modules and wafers were more than halved from a year earlier. Reaffirmed FY2012 guidance. Sees Q3 revenue of $200M-$220M vs. $228M consensus, and Q3 total solar wafer and module shipments of 510-530 MW.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:07 PM
  • YELP

    Crushed earlier this week due to concerns about the impact of its Aug. 29 lockup expiration,...

    Crushed earlier this week due to concerns about the impact of its Aug. 29 lockup expiration, Yelp (YELP +6.3%) is bouncing strongly today. Short-covering is a likely factor: 15.4% of the company's float was shorted as of July 31, and judging by Facebook's pre-expiration activity, more shorts may have piled in during the recent selloff.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM | 2 Comments
  • EAT

    Shares of Brinker International (EAT +1.9%) carve out another gain as they trade just off...

    Shares of Brinker International (EAT +1.9%) carve out another gain as they trade just off 52-week highs. A dividend hike and an extra $500M added on to the company's share repurchase program appears to be helping to bring in buyers.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM
  • CYCC

    Cyclacel Pharmaceuticals (CYCC -4.5%) slides after earlier announcing a 1-for-7 reverse stock...

    Cyclacel Pharmaceuticals (CYCC -4.5%) slides after earlier announcing a 1-for-7 reverse stock split, effective today at 5:00 pm. The split is intended to satisfy the $1.00 minimum bid price requirement for continued listing on NASDAQ. The stock has been pummeled since early March on a series of disappointing earnings reports, as well as less-than-stellar Phase 1 data on its two marquee drugs in June, which has since cut nearly 40% off its market cap.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM
  • DWRE

    Demandware (DWRE +3.1%) moves higher after Raymond James starts coverage with an Outperform and...

    Demandware (DWRE +3.1%) moves higher after Raymond James starts coverage with an Outperform and $33 PT. Bulls and bears have been playing tug-of-war with the company's shares this summer: the former group is optimistic about the growth potential of Demandware's e-commerce infrastructure software, while the latter is worried about heavy European exposure.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM
  • HMSY

    It looks like "buy the rumor, sell the news" today for health benefits coordinator HMS Holdings...

    It looks like "buy the rumor, sell the news" today for health benefits coordinator HMS Holdings (NASDAQ:HMSY). The stock is down 6.3% after the company announced that it's been awarded a three-year contract by the Commonwealth of Virginia, Department of Medical Assistance Services, to serve as the Commonwealth's Medicaid Recovery Audit Contractor.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM | 3 Comments
  • IDCC

    3G/4G patent owner InterDigital (IDCC +3.7%) trades higher after William Blair starts coverage...

    3G/4G patent owner InterDigital (IDCC +3.7%) trades higher after William Blair starts coverage with an Outperform. Hammered over the first 5 months of the year, InterDigital has rallied strongly this summer, aided by a $375M deal with Intel and a favorable patent ruling.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM
  • CASC

    Oncothyreon (ONTY +10.8%) pops after Stifel Nicolaus initiated coverage this morning with a Buy....

    Oncothyreon (ONTY +10.8%) pops after Stifel Nicolaus initiated coverage this morning with a Buy. Not much detail is given, but a couple of catalysts are worth noting. First, its lead product candidate, Stimuvax, is a cancer vaccine in the latter stages of being evaluated in two Phase 3 clinical trials for the treatment of non-small cell lung cancer, with the results due out in early 2013. Second, the shares have lost nearly half their market value since early March, and with the stock currently trading off its 50-day moving average as support, it could be spring-loaded for an upside surprise.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM
  • SOHU

    Sohu (SOHU +4.2%) rallies after Citron Research suggests Qihoo 360's entry into the Chinese...

    Sohu (SOHU +4.2%) rallies after Citron Research suggests Qihoo 360's entry into the Chinese search market makes Sohu, whose Sogou unit is the market's #2 player after Baidu, a buyout target. Citron has issued a steady stream of bearish commentary about Qihoo over the last nine months.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM
  • FRO

    Frontline (FRO +5.2%) is upgraded to Neutral from Sell at Goldman, which says valuation no...

    Frontline (FRO +5.2%) is upgraded to Neutral from Sell at Goldman, which says valuation no longer supports a Sell rating while staying cautious on the crude tanker outlook for the next two years given supply/demand imbalance. The firm also bumps Seadrill (SDRL -0.3%) to Neutral, reflecting its positive view on day rates and deep water drilling fundamentals.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM | 8 Comments
  • SSYS

    Stratasys (SSYS -5%) and 3D Systems (DDD -3.7%) could be two more victims of Autodesk's Q2...

    Stratasys (SSYS -5%) and 3D Systems (DDD -3.7%) could be two more victims of Autodesk's Q2 report. Product designers often use the companies' expensive 3D printers in tandem with Autodesk's CAD software. (more on ADSK)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM | 11 Comments
  • ELY

    Shares of Callaway Golf (ELY -7.5%) slump after the company announces a series of transactions...

    Shares of Callaway Golf (ELY -7.5%) slump after the company announces a series of transactions in connection to its preferred stock and a private placement of convertible senior notes.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM
  • SVU

    UBS takes on the role of party pooper over the building buzz that Supervalu (NYSE:SVU) could be...

    UBS takes on the role of party pooper over the building buzz that Supervalu (NYSE:SVU) could be sold off, either in its entirety or in pieces. The firm sees a deal unlikely at a choice premium due to Supervalu's debt load and calls a turnaround the most likely scenario. SVU +9.1% to $2.35.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:10 AM | 1 Comment
  • KODK

    Shares of Kodak (EKDKQ.PK) roar to a 12.2% gain on word that the company plans to sell its...

    Shares of Kodak (EKDKQ.PK) roar to a 12.2% gain on word that the company plans to sell its document imaging business and iconic print film business to raise cash. The company sees completing the sales during the first half of 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM | 1 Comment
  • AMZN

    Amazon (AMZN +0.9%) and Comcast (CMCSA -0.5%) expand an existing licensing agreement to add...

    Amazon (AMZN +0.9%) and Comcast (CMCSA -0.5%) expand an existing licensing agreement to add hundreds of NBC TV episodes, both new and old, to Amazon Prime Instant Video. With an arsenal of over 22K movies and TV episodes, the Amazon streaming service is a formidable challenger to Netflix (NFLX -2.5%).

     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM | 1 Comment
  • AWRE

    DSL software provider Aware (AWRE +4.2%) rallies after selling $16M worth of DSL patents to...

    DSL software provider Aware (AWRE +4.2%) rallies after selling $16M worth of DSL patents to privately-owned TQ Delta. Aware soared in April after selling $75M in patents to Intel.  (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM
  • CPRX

    Catalyst Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:CPRX) pops 10% at the open, apparently sparked by a positive...

    Catalyst Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:CPRX) pops 10% at the open, apparently sparked by a positive Seeking Alpha article highlighting upcoming Phase 2 data on its drug for treatment of addiction to cocaine and other addictive substances. Author Scott Matusow thinks CPRX could gap up similar to THLD, VRTX and SRPT after their recent data results.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:39 AM
  • ARUN

    Aruba Networks (ARUN +14.4%) takes off after posting a strong FQ4 report that, along with rival...

    Aruba Networks (ARUN +14.4%) takes off after posting a strong FQ4 report that, along with rival Cisco's FQ4 wireless sales data, showed the market for enterprise Wi-Fi gear remains a strong point in a soft IT spending climate. Deferred revenue reached $103M, +13% Q/Q and +50% Y/Y, and Cowen is happy with growing adoption of Aruba's network management software. During its earnings call, Aruba guided for FQ1 revenue of $141M-$143M and EPS of $0.17, in-line with a consensus of $141.4M and $0.17.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:36 AM
  • ADBE

    Adobe (NASDAQ:ADBE) -3.6% in response to Autodesk's Q2 disaster. The companies both sell...

    Adobe (NASDAQ:ADBE) -3.6% in response to Autodesk's Q2 disaster. The companies both sell high-end software to media/entertainment professionals, which leads many to think the latter's problems have implications for the former. Also, Adobe is receiving negative analyst comments about sales of its flagship CS6 suite.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM
  • ARUN

    Premarket gainers: ARUN +14%. MTSL +12%. CPRX +10%. LLY +8%. DSCO +7%. FRO +5%. ONTY +5%....

    Premarket gainers: ARUN +14%. MTSL +12%. CPRX +10%. LLY +8%. DSCO +7%. FRO +5%. ONTY +5%.
    Losers: ADSK -22%. HMSY -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • ATPAQ

    ATP Oil & Gas (ATPG) -19.5% premarket after disclosing it does not plan to appeal...

    ATP Oil & Gas (ATPG) -19.5% premarket after disclosing it does not plan to appeal NASDAQ's determination to delist the company's common stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:21 AM
  • MSG

    More on Madison Square Garden (NASDAQ:MSG): Revenue breakdown: MSG Media +20% Y/Y to $167M; MSG...

    More on Madison Square Garden (NASDAQ:MSG): Revenue breakdown: MSG Media +20% Y/Y to $167M; MSG Entertainment +41% to 50.98; MSG Sports +74% to $131.2M. Adjusted operating cash flow rose 36% Y/Y to $283.2M. Playoff runs by Rangers and Knicks contributed to results. Shares +8.3% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:16 AM
  • LLY

    Eli Lilly (NYSE:LLY) +7.4% premarket after two large studies show its experimental...

    Eli Lilly (NYSE:LLY) +7.4% premarket after two large studies show its experimental Alzheimer’s treatment slowed the decline of cognition in some patients, although it failed to meet its primary goals. The finding that the drug slowed the worsening of mental loss in mild to moderate patients wasn’t expected by analysts, who had given the drug a less than 20% chance of showing a benefit.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:11 AM | 1 Comment
  • ADSK

    Baird defends Autodesk (NASDAQ:ADSK) in the wake of its disappointing Q2 report (I, II, III),...

    Baird defends Autodesk (NASDAQ:ADSK) in the wake of its disappointing Q2 report (I, II, III), saying shares should be bought on weakness. The firm sees most of the shortfall tied to fixable execution issues and temporary weakness in a few geographic regions. Analysts at JP Morgan and Bank of America weren't quite so charitable, with respective downgrades to Neutral and Underperform. Shares of ADSK -22.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:52 AM
  • SVU

    Northcoast Research Holdings doesn't believe Supervalu (NYSE:SVU) will end up being sold in one...

    Northcoast Research Holdings doesn't believe Supervalu (NYSE:SVU) will end up being sold in one piece as reported earlier. A more likely scenario will be to see the grocery store operator broken up into pieces and sold off to unlock more value, according to the firm. SVU +10.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:44 AM | 5 Comments

  • EU shares are lower in early trading as markets get gloomy about the prospects for more Fed...

    EU shares are lower in early trading as markets get gloomy about the prospects for more Fed money printing. "Fed QE is a bit of an each way bet at the moment... But you've got to bear in mind that the rally that we've seen is on expectations of further QE, so I think it's already priced in," says CMC analyst Michael Hewson. Euro Stoxx 50 -0.3%, London -0.2%, Paris -0.4%, Frankfurt -0.2%, Madrid -0.2%, Milan -0.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 AM

  • Taking their cues from Wall Street, Asian shares are lower after the prospects of Fed easing...

    Taking their cues from Wall Street, Asian shares are lower after the prospects of Fed easing softened following James Bullard's hawkish comments on CNBC. Concerns about the global economy and Greece ahead of meetings this weekend also weigh on the mood. Japan -1.2%, Hong Kong -1.1%, China -0.9%, India -0.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 AM
